On Tue, 06 Jul 2004 21:04:55 +0100, Colin Green <cgreen@...> wrote:
> Did you discover any new NEAT or NEAT like research going on or any
> interesting commercial connections?

Not really.

I attended a "Genetic Algorithms in Industry" tutorial, which actually
turned out to be two guys from Dow Chemical, so it was really "Genetic
Algorithms in the Chemical Industry".  They spoke in very vague terms
for the first half hour, and when they finally put some data up on the
slides, when someone asked what they were representing, they mumbled
something about how they couldn't say what the graphs actually showed
because it was proprietary.

GECCO is apparently a fusion of different conferences, and it seemed
to me that many more of the papers and workshops/tutorials were geared
more toward Genetic Programming than any other use of GAs.

There was an interesting presentation in my LBP session by a guy from
a company that had successfully used GP techniques to identify
unexploded ordnance in military artillery ranges that were to be
converted to civilian use.  I spoke to another guy from somewhere
called Aerospace Corp who said he was skeptical of ANNs and mostly
looking for GP-based approaches to analyzing aerial and satellite
photography.  It seems to me that ANN-based approaches to these sorts
of fuzzy recognition problems would be more promising than GP
approaches...so if anything I got a lot of ideas about potential
commercial connections, if anything.

Maybe Ken or Joseph had different experiences, though.

Derek
